goal.en: “Fieldwork in Northeast Asia: Methodology and Ethnographic Writing“ is an advanced fieldwork course designed for senior undergraduates and graduate students at the university level. The course focuses on guiding learners to acquire the knowledge, skills, abilities, tools, and habits required for conducting social and cultural field interviews and investigations. It aims to lead learners to gain firsthand experience in the complete process of engaging in social and cultural fieldwork for specific research topics. The course unfolds along two main axes: firstly, systematically introducing the rationale and methods of social field interviews, the literature axis of research topics, and expert insights; secondly, conducting cross-domain field visits to Nei-Wu, Okinawa, and Ishigaki Island to explore the local Hakka culture and stone weir culture. Learners will actively engage in research planning, interviews and investigations, documentation and analysis, presentation (report writing), and sharing related to the identified issues during the field practice.
goal.ch: 「東北亞社會文化田野實作」是針對大學高年級與研究生所設計的一門社會與文化訪調的進階田野實作課程。課程將著重在引導學習者習得進行社會實地(田野)訪調與考察研究議題所需具備的知識、技術、能力、工具與習性，並將帶領學習者實地瞭解並親身體會—針對特定研究議題投入社會文化田野實踐過程的完整體驗。具體課程進行將沿著兩條軸線展開：其一，將系統性地介紹社會實地(田野)訪調的理路與方法及研究議題的文獻主軸與專家分享；其二，將前往新屋、沖繩、石垣島對其當地的客家文化與石滬文化進行跨域實地訪調，並實際投入相關議題的研究規劃、訪談與調查、紀錄與分析、呈現(撰寫報告)與分享。
